title: Australia , Kongsberg to Build Long - Range Missiles in Newcastle
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Australia will invest up to A$850 million ($573 million) in partnership with Kongsberg Gruppen ASA to manufacture long-range missiles in the city of Newcastle, north of Sydney.
Most Read from BloombergThe new plant will build and service Naval Strike Missiles and Joint Strike Missiles for the Australian military, Pat Conroy, minister for defense industry, said in a statement on Thursday.
The Joint Strike Missile — which can be fitted to the F-35A aircraft — and Naval Strike Missiles are modern anti-ship cruise missiles designed to attack enemy warships.
Construction of the missile factory is due to start later this year in the Newcastle Airport precinct and once complete is expected to employ about 100 people, according to the government.

title: Hezbollah rockets hit Golan after Israel strikes deep in Lebanon
message:
Hezbollah has launched dozens of rockets at the occupied Golan Heights after Israeli aircraft struck deep inside Lebanon, as fears of an all-out war grow.
The Israeli military said it hit Hezbollah weapons storage facilities in the Bekaa Valley overnight.
In response, Hezbollah, which is backed by Iran, said it targeted Israeli military positions in the Golan with a rocket barrage.
Israeli authorities said two homes were hit and one person was injured.
Meanwhile, the Palestinian Fatah movement accused Israel of assassinating a senior member of its armed wing in Lebanon in an effort to ignite a regional conflict.

title: US carrier , warships arrive in West Asia amid prospect of Iran , Hezbollah response to Israel
message:
The US’s Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier and its accompanying warships have arrived in the West Asia region amid the country and the Israeli regime’s fears of Iran and Hezbollah’s promised severe response to Tel Aviv’s assassination of senior resistance figures.
"USS Abraham Lincoln (CVN 72), equipped with F-35C and F/A-18 Block III fighters, entered the US Central Command (USCENTCOM) area of responsibility," the post read.

title: Second Navy aircraft carrier arrives in Mideast amid regional conflict fears
message:
A second United States aircraft carrier, the USS Abraham Lincoln, arrived in the Middle East on Wednesday escorted by guided missile destroyers, the U.S. Central Command said.
The carrier, equipped with F-35 fighter jets, added to the U.S. ships already in the region, including the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier, which arrived in mid-July.
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered the Lincoln to transit from the Indo-Pacific to the Middle East earlier this month as the Biden administration prepares to defend Israel against an expected Iranian attack.
In addition to the Lincoln, Austin ordered the USS Georgia, a guided missile submarine, to the Middle East in a rare acknowledgment of U.S. submarine whereabouts.
The Pentagon said the U.S. is sending additional forces to support Israel if there is an attack and to be prepared for any escalation.

title: Israeli Assassinations Are Near - Daily In Lebanon , Airstrikes Reaching Deeper
message:

These strikes occurred more than 40 miles from the Israeli border, and Israeli typically launches such rare long-range operations in response to deadly Hezbollah rocket attacks.

title: Ukraine Reports Intense Fighting Near Pokrovsk As Russian Forces Press For Breakthrough
message:
Ukraine's military said its forces came under repeated attack on August 21 around the town of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk region, where Russian forces are pressing for a breakthrough.
In a statement, the General Staff of the Ukrainian military said there were 46 Russian attacks in the Pokrovsk area over the course of day.
Most of them were repelled, according to the General Staff, but some continued into the late evening hours.
The governor of the Bryansk region of Russia, Aleksandr Bogomaz, said Russian forces prevented an attempted incursion into the region by Ukrainian troops.
Ukraine said separately that it had destroyed a Russian pontoon bridges with U.S.-made weapons in Russia's Kursk region.

title: Bulletproof Trump In NC : First Outdoor Rally Since Assassination Attempt | NewsRadio 740 KTRH
message:
Another day, and another DNC convention counter-rally for former president Donald Trump, who held his first outdoor rally since the assassination attempt, with a stop in Asheboro, North Carolina.
With thousands in attendance, Trump was surrounded by a wall of bulletproof glass while he spoke at the podium.
There was also a moment when Trump left the stage because someone in the crowd was having a medical emergency.
Trump, along with VP candidate, Sen. JD Vance hit on national security, while highlighting the Biden-Harris’ record on Ukraine and the botched withdrawal from Afghanistan.
And probably the highlight was when Trump told the crowd he has finally decided on a nickname for Kamala Harris.

title: Trump holds first outdoor rally since attempted assassination
message:
It was his first big outdoor event since being lightly wounded in an attempted assassination at a similarly open site in Butler, Pennsylvania, a month ago.
That attack left one rally participant dead before the 20-year-old gunman was killed by a Secret Service sniper.
The Secret Service recommended that Trump stick to more easily controllable indoor venues such as sports arenas.
The Secret Service does not comment publicly on security operations and did not respond to requests for comment on Wednesday's preparations.
At one point during his speech, Trump left the stage and entered the crowd to check on an attendee who was suffering a medical issue.

title: Trump holds first outdoor rally since attempted assassination
message: An email has been sent to with a link to confirm list signup.

title: Biden continues to advocate for Israel - Hamas cease - fire in call with Netanyahu
message:
President Joe Biden spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday, discussing the ongoing defense of Israel against Iran and proxies like Hezbollah.
Israeli tank and drone strikes in Gaza on Wednesday killed at least 17 people, according to hospital staff and Associated Press journalists who counted the bodies.
Lebanon’s Hezbollah on Wednesday launched more than 50 rockets, hitting a number of private homes in the Israel-annexed Golan Heights.
Hezbollah said the attack was in response to an Israeli strike deep into Lebanon on Tuesday night.
Hamas is believed to still be holding around 110 hostages captured during the Oct. 7 attacks that started the war.

title: Iran signals promised strike on Israel may not be imminent
message:
Even Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, the country’s most powerful security force, said that an attack might not come right away.
Immediately after Haniyeh’s assassination, which came just hours after Israel killed a senior Hezbollah commander near Beirut, the region went on high alert.
In April, Iran retaliated against Israel for a deadly strike on the Iranian Embassy complex in Damascus, which killed seven people, including senior military advisers.
Iran’s mission to the United Nations also hinted that the response may take a different form.
“The timing, conditions, and manner of Iran’s response will be meticulously orchestrated to ensure that it occurs at a moment of maximum surprise,” the statement said.

title: Trump speaks from behind bulletproof glass at 1st outdoor rally since Butler shooting
message:
Trump speaks from behind bulletproof glass at 1st outdoor rally since Butler shootingDonald Trump spoke behind bulletproof glass at his rally in North Carolina on Wednesday as new security measures are being put in place after the assassination attempt against the former president.
Trump was surrounded by the barriers as he addressed supporters in Asheboro.
The event marked his first outdoor rally since the shooting on July 13 in Butler, Pennsylvania, during which Trump and two others were injured and one person was killed.
At one point, Trump momentarily stepped out of the glass and walked off stage to check on someone in the crowd who he said may be struggling with the heat.
The use of ballistic glass is typically only used for sitting presidents.

title: Police charge three men over alleged roles in  muscle gang
message:
Police today charged three men for their alleged roles as a "freelance gang" that was allegedly being hired to carry out shootings, home invasions and kidnappings across southwest Sydney.
Two 20-year-old men from Fairfield West and Mt Druitt and an 18-year-old man from Lakemba were arrested during raids of homes early yesterday.
READ MORE: Aussie girl stabbed in London attack refused to miss Taylor SwiftPolice have charged three men in Sydney for their alleged roles as a crime gang for hire.
Police will allege the Fairfield West man led the gang and accepted tasks from organised crime networks.
(NSW Police)The three men were refused bail and were scheduled to appear before court yesterday.

title: Bronze Age Warfare : Insights From Archaeological , Textual Evidence
message:
"By considering the most frequently attested weapons employed in siege warfare it is possible to assess the function and effectiveness of these weapons.
Typical weapons for the Middle Bronze age are a dagger, battle-axe, spear or javelin.
"The Kirta Epic illustrates a number of details regarding siege warfare: 'Like grasshoppers, you will invade the field, like locusts the edges of the steppe-land.
"From this passage several observations regarding Bronze Age warfare can be made.
Finally, it also provides a glimpse into the real discomforts that siege warfare inflicted on a population [and their animals]," Burke elaborated.

title: Irish man fighting in Ukraine reported missing , presumed dead
message:
Irish man fighting in Ukraine reported missing, presumed deadUkrainian soldiers raising the country's flag.
Picture: GettyBy Henry MooreAn Irish man fighting for Ukraine has been reported missing, presumed dead.
According to reports, Ryzhuk had been serving as a volunteer in Eastern Ukraine when he was reported missing.
If confirmed dead, he would become the fourth Irish citizen to die fighting in Ukraine.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 21 August 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
More than three thousand shellings were also carried out at the positions of Ukrainian troops and settlements.
In the Toretsky direction Russians five times attacked Ukrainian troops near Toretsk and Northern.
Four counter-attacks of the AFU 72nd Mechanised Brigade and the 125th Territorial Defence Brigade have been repelled.

title: The Future of India Air Superiority : Beyond the Super - Sukhoi and Towards 5th - 6th Generation Jets – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
The Future of India’s Air Superiority: Beyond the Super-Sukhoi and Towards 5th-6th Generation Jets| BySOURCE: AFIAs technology in the aerospace domain advances, India faces the inevitable need to replace its fleet of Su-30MKI fighter jets, despite upcoming upgrades.
Fifth- and sixth-generation fighter jets are designed to operate as “spies and snipers,” equipped with the latest technology to outperform adversaries.
While previous-generation jets can supplement these advanced aircraft, frontline fighters must incorporate cutting-edge stealth, sensors, and weaponry.
Europe’s decision to bypass the fifth generation and move directly to sixth-generation programs, such as the Future Combat Air System (FCAS) and Global Combat Air Programme (GCAP), reflects the need to catch up with the U.S. in this domain.
By leveraging domestic talent, collaborating with agencies like ISRO, and securing the necessary funding and technology, India can ensure its place in the next generation of air superiority.

title: Army puts new unit loaded with cutting - edge tech to the test
message:
But somewhere up above, the soldiers playing the enemy—a unit dubbed Geronimo—were watching.
The problem is that distributing tech in that way can take years, and it led to fielding drones that were literal museum pieces.
While each brigade has a version of the MFRC, the MFRC is furthest along in its “transformation process,” a 101st Airborne PAO said.
With the Switchblade, the strike approval process is simplified for high-payoff targets—like Geronimo’s vehicle commander—said 1st Lt. Noah Paffenroth, commander of another MFRC platoon.
Just one day in, Hendrick’s platoon got a drone airborne and spotted three of Geronimo’s artillery pieces in a nearby field.

title: RNC Chair Michael Whatley :  Were in a Great Place to Flip the Senate
message:

If Republicans win those two seats, they flip the Senate, he explained.

title: Poorly trained recruits contribute to loss of Ukrainian territory on eastern front , commanders say
message:
Ukrainian commanders and soldiers say some new troops refuse to fire at the enemyKYIV, Ukraine -- Some new Ukrainian soldiers refuse to fire at the enemy.
Others spoke on the condition that they be identified only by their call signs in keeping with Ukrainian military protocol.
Russian soldiers are now just 10 kilometers (6.2 miles) away.
The new troops lack even a minimal level of training, commanders and soldiers from four brigades defending the Pokrovsk area said.
He said brigade commanders “are looking for an explanation for tactical failures.”“Likewise, the brigade commander has the appropriate tools to influence morale.

title: US Mercenary Commander Says Ukrainian Army Lacks Discipline
message:
https://sputnikglobe.com/20240822/us-mercenary-commander-points-to-lack-of-discipline-among-ukrainian-army-1119869564.htmlUS Mercenary Commander Points to Lack of Discipline Among Ukrainian ArmyUS Mercenary Commander Points to Lack of Discipline Among Ukrainian ArmySputnik InternationalThe commander of a foreign mercenary group operating in Ukraine took to social media to complain about the lack of discipline among the Ukrainian army.
According to the group's official website, the Chosen Company was raised and organized in collaboration with the Ukrainian armed forces.
O'Leary’s team came under heavy scrutiny after a story from The New York Times in July alleged that members of the Chosen Company executed Russian soldiers who had already surrendered.
Nevertheless, the commander of the foreign mercenary group went on to detail his frustrations over what he witnessed among the Ukrainian soldiers in a series of subsequent posts on X.
Two members of the Chosen Company, Lance Lawrence and Andrew Webber, were apparently killed during this operation in 2023.

title: Ukraine attacks Moscow in one of largest ever drone strikes on Russian capital
message:
Ukraine attacked Moscow on Wednesday with at least 11 drones that were shot down by air defenses in what Russian officials called one of the biggest drone strikes on the capital since the war in Ukraine began in February 2022.
The war — largely a grinding artillery and drone battle across the fields, forests and villages of eastern Ukraine — escalated on Aug. 6 when Ukraine sent thousands of soldiers over the border into Russia's western Kursk region.
For months, Ukraine has also fought an increasingly damaging drone war against the refineries and airfields of Russia, the world's second largest oil exporter, though major drone attacks on the Moscow region — with a population of over 21 million — have been rarer.

title: Putin slow response to the Kursk attack could test the patience of some of his backers in Russia
message:
Russia was caught unprepared by the offensive and reportedly is drafting conscripts to repel some of Ukraine’s most battle-hardened units.
Putin has a history of responding slowly to various crises in his tenure, and he has so far played down the attack.
Putin is dependent on their acquiescence, said Ekaterina Schulmann, a nonresident scholar at the Carnegie Russia Eurasia Center in Berlin.

title: Stunning Sci - Fi RPG  Beyond Galaxyland  Blasts Off On Switch Next Month
message:
Inspired by sci-fi movies of the 1980s and classic RPGs, Beyond Galaxyland is bound to tick a lot of boxes for a lot of people.
Beyond Galaxyland looks to split your time between the expected turn-based battles, platforming, puzzle solving and a monster-catching mechanic that will undoubtedly leave us wanting to catch 'em all.
● Active turn-based combat: Engage in strategic turn-based battles against a vast range of galactic nemeses, with time-responsive defensive gameplay to minimise damage.
● A classic sci-fi adventure: A semi-open 2.5D adventure-RPG in a classic sci-fi fish-out-of-water tale that pays homage to family-friendly adventure and sci-fi movies.
You'll be able to pick up Beyond Galaxyland on the Switch eShop next month for £14.99 / €17.99 / $17.99.

title: Magicmyna Unveils MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Magicmyna Unveils MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System| BySOURCE: AFIMagicmyna, a Bengaluru-based startup, has made significant strides in drone technology with the launch of its MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System.
MuniTrix 4 is a UAV-based solution capable of delivering payloads carrying up to four 60mm or two 81/82mm mortar ammunition.
The system boasts an advanced algorithm that accurately determines the impact area of the mortar shells.
Moreover, it offers flexibility in choosing the type of warhead, including impact detonation (IMP), delayed detonation (DLY), near-surface detonation (NSB), and distance detonation (PRX).
To ensure operational reliability, the MuniTrix 4 incorporates a jammer jamming system to counter electronic warfare threats.

title: Happy Birthday Joe Strummer ! | 101 . 5 KGB
message:
Today is Joe Strummer's birthday!
The late co-founder, of The Clash, put the band together in 1976, in the wake of the rise of punk in the U.S., following bands like The Ramones.
The Clash would make an impact with their second album, "Give 'Em Enough Rope" in 1978, when it reached No.
Unlike many of their peers in the England and even in the States, The Clash attained a critical acclaim for their raw combination of political strife and youthful angst in their music.
They would hit big in the US, with their iconic London Calling in 1979, despite the backlash that punk would receive following the failed tour of The Sex Pistols.

title: Biden presses Netanyahu on need to reach Gaza truce deal
message:
Biden presses Netanyahu on need to reach Gaza truce dealreuters_tickers5 minutesBy Nidal al-Mughrabi and James MackenzieCAIRO/JERUSALEM (Reuters) -U.S. President Joe Biden on Wednesday pressed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on the urgency of sealing a deal for a truce in Gaza and the release of hostages, the White House said, but Israel and Hamas stuck firmly to their demands.
These include an end to Israel’s Gaza operation, a full Israeli pullout and a deal to exchange Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel.
In Gaza itself, the Israeli military said jets hit around 30 targets throughout the enclave including tunnels, launch sites and an observation post.
The Israeli military said in a statement that it hit Hamas militants operating at a command centre inside a compound that previously served as a school.
Israel’s military campaign has killed more than 40,000 people in Gaza since October, according to Palestinian health authorities.
